member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.ServiceLogCategories
member.summary: Category names traced by the service infrastructure. By separating it out from the default Web API categories and from other user categories it is possible to filter them out in the tracing logic.

The name of the connection string to look up.
member.returns: The connection string; or null if not present.

member.summary: Formats the input string to be user visible using , per FxCop's rule

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.FormatInvariant(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Formats the input string to be user visible using .

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.SplitAndTrim(System.String,System.Char[])
member.summary: Splits a string into segments based on a given . The segments are trimmed and empty segments are removed.
member.param: The string to split.
An array of Unicode characters that delimit the substrings in this instance, an empty array that contains no delimiters, or null.
member.returns: An containing the resulting segments.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties
member.summary: The "alert" property contains properties specific to the alert in a notification targeting Apple Push Notification Service (APNS). It is intended to be used from the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialization information and streaming context.
member.param: A containing information about the to be initialized.
A that indicates the source destination and context information of a serialized stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.Body
member.summary: The text of the alert message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.ActionLocKey
member.summary: If a string is specified, the system displays an alert with two buttons. The string is used as a key to get a localized string in the current localization to use for the right button’s title instead of “View”.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.LocKey
member.summary: A key to an alert-message string in a Localizable.strings file for the current localization (which is set by the user’s language preference). The key string can be formatted with %@ and %n$@ specifiers to take the variables specified in loc-args.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.LogArgs
member.summary: Variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers in loc-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.AlertProperties.LaunchImage
member.summary: The filename of an image file in the application bundle; it may include the extension or omit it. The image is used as the launch image when users tap the action button or move the action slider. If this property is not specified, the system either uses the previous snapshot, uses the image identified by the UILaunchImageFile key in the application’s Info.plist file, or falls back to Default.png.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage
member.summary: The helps generating a notification payload targeting Apple Push Notification Service. Notifications can be sent using the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.IPushMessage
member.summary: Marker interface identifying various notification payloads that can be sent to the Notification Hub.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class enabling creation a notification message targeting Apple Push Notification Service. Set the appropriate properties on the message and submit through the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given message and an optional of the notification.
member.param: The notification alert message.

A relative to the current time. At the end of the lifetime, the notification is no longer valid and can be discarded. If this value is non-null, APNs stores the notification and tries to deliver the notification at least once. Specify null to indicate that the notification expires immediately and that APNs should not store the notification at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialization information and streaming context.
member.param: A containing information about the to be initialized.
A that indicates the source destination and context information of a serialized stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.ToString
member.summary: Provides a JSON encoded representation of this
member.returns: A JSON encoded string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.Aps
member.summary: Gets the for this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.Expiration
member.summary: Sets or gets the lifetime of the notification. At the end of the lifetime, the notification is no longer valid and can be discarded. If this value is non-null, APNs stores the notification and tries to deliver the notification at least once. Specify null to indicate that the notification expires immediately and that APNs should not store the notification at all.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApplePushMessage.JsonPayload
member.summary: As an alternative to building the notification by initializing the directly, it is possible to provide a complete JSON representation which will be sent to the Notification Hub unaltered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApsProperties.Alert
member.summary: The alert message as a single string. For more complex alert message options, please use .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApsProperties.AlertProperties
member.summary: The alert message as a dictionary with additional properties describing the alert such as localization information, which image to display, etc. If the alert is simply a string then please use .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApsProperties.Badge
member.summary: The number to display as the badge of the application icon. If this property is absent, the badge is not changed. To remove the badge, set the value of this property to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApsProperties.Sound
P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.ApsProperties.ContentAvailable
member.summary: Provide this key with a value of 1 to indicate that new content is available. This is used to support Newsstand apps and background content downloads.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController
member.summary: The defines an endpoint for managing installation registrations for a Notification Hub associated with this service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.PutInstallation(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation)
member.summary: Enables the registration of a device installation for push notifications via PUT request. If the specified installationId does not exist on the notification hub, a new installation is created and registered. If the specified installationId already exists, the installation is modified.
member.param: The installation id to register or modify.
The object to register.
member.returns: describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.DeleteInstallation(System.String)
member.summary: Enables the deletion of the specified device installation registration via DELETE request.
member.param: The installation id to deregister from Notification Hub.
member.returns: describing the result of the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.CopyTagsToInstallation(Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs.Installation,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the tags from the specified set to the Installation object, excluding InstallationId and UserId (conditionally).
member.param: The Installation object to copy tags to.
The set of tags to copy.
True to copy the UserId tag. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.GetTagsAssociatedWithInstallationId(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a set of unique tags associated with the specified installation id from all the associated registrations.
member.param: The installation id to get tags for.
member.returns: A set of tags associated with the specified installation Id. If installation id doesn't exist, set will have zero elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.GetUserIdTagFromHashset(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Gets the UserId tag, if present, from the specified collection.
member.param: The collection to search for the UserId substring.
member.returns: Null if no UserId tag was found; else the UserId tag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.UpsertInstallationAsync(Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs.Installation)
member.summary: Invokes the create/update operation.
member.param: The to create or update.
member.returns: A representing the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Controllers.NotificationInstallationsController.DeleteInstallationAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Invokes the delete operation.
member.param: The installation id to delete.
member.returns: A representing the operation.

The installation object parsed from body.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 1 and 99 that will be displayed in the Count field of the Tile. A value of 0 means the Count will not be displayed. If this property is not set, the Count display will not change during an update.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.FlipTile.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image of the front of the tile. If this property is an empty URI, the background image of the front of the tile will not change during an update.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.FlipTile.BackBackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets a background image of the back of the tile. If this property is an empty URI, the background image of the back of the tile will not change during an update.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.FlipTile.BackTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the title to display at the bottom of the back of the tile. If this property is an empty string, the title on the back of the tile will not change during an update.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.FlipTile.BackContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display on the back of the tile, above the title. If this property is an empty string, the content on the back of the tile will not change during an update.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage
member.summary: The helps generating a notification payload targeting Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome (GCM). Notifications can be sent using the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class enabling creation of a notification message targeting Google Cloud Messaging for Chrome (GCM).Set the appropriate properties on the message and submit through the

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given set of parameters and an optional .
member.param: A relative to the current time. The value of this parameter must be a duration from 0 to 2,419,200 seconds (28 days), and it corresponds to the maximum period of time for which GCM will store and try to deliver the message. Requests that don't contain this field default to the maximum period of 4 weeks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialization information and streaming context.
member.param: A containing information about the to be initialized.
A that indicates the source destination and context information of a serialized stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.ToString
member.summary: Provides a JSON encoded representation of this
member.returns: A JSON encoded string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.CollapseKey
member.summary: A collapse key is an arbitrary string that is used to collapse a group of like messages when the device is offline, so that only the most recent message gets sent to the client. For example, "New mail", "Updates available", and so on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.DelayWhileIdle
member.summary: Indicates whether the message should be delivered while the device is idle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.Data
member.summary: A collection or name-value properties to include in the message. Properties must be simple types, i.e. they can not be nested.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.TimeToLiveInSeconds
member.summary: The Time to Live (TTL) property lets the sender specify the maximum lifespan of a message. The value of this parameter must be a duration from 0 to 2,419,200 seconds, and it corresponds to the maximum period of time for which GCM will store and try to deliver the message. Requests that don't contain this field default to the maximum period of 4 weeks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.GooglePushMessage.JsonPayload
member.summary: As an alternative to building the notification by initializing the directly, it is possible to provide a complete JSON representation which will be sent to the Notification Hub unaltered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.IconicTile.WideContent3
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that displays on the third row of the wide tile size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.IconicTile.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the Tile. Setting this property overrides the default theme color that is set on the phone.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation
member.summary: The contains information for registering a device installation for push notifications through a notification hub.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.PushChannel
member.summary: The channel URI if registering the installation for WNS; Device Token if registering for APNS.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.Platform
member.summary: The platform for this installation. The platform must be one of the following values: wns, apns. Where wns stands for "Windows Push Notification Services", and apns is "Apple Push Notification Service".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.InstallationId
member.summary: The device installation id to register.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.Templates
member.summary: A dictionary of template names to objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.SecondaryTiles
member.summary: A dictionary of secondary tile names to objects to register with this installation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationInstallation.Tags
member.summary: A list of tags to register with this installation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationSecondaryTile
member.summary: The contains information for registering a WNS secondary tile with a .

member.summary: The channel URI to register with the tile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationSecondaryTile.Tags
member.summary: A set of tags to register with the tile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationSecondaryTile.Templates
member.summary: A dictionary of template names to objects to register with the tile.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationTemplate
member.summary: A contains information for registering a template with a .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationTemplate.Body
member.summary: The notification payload for this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.NotificationTemplate.Headers
member.summary: For WNS, a dictionary of header names to values that specify the notification type (i.e. "X-WNS-TYPE":"wns/toast"). For all other platforms this property is meaningless.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.PushClient.EnableTestSend
member.summary: When test send is enabled, all notifications only reach up to 10 devices for each send call and the SendNotificationAsync method return a detailed list of the outcomes for all those notification deliveries (for example, authentication errors, throttling errors, and so on).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TemplatePushMessage
member.summary: The helps generating a notification payload targeting devices that have registered with a template registration. A template lets the device specify the shape of notifications that it wants to receive including a set of keywords which it wants the sender to fill in. Instead of the sender building the entire notification, it simply sets the keyword values. The Notification Hub will then build a notification using the particular template registered by device and the keywords provided by the sender. This makes it much easier to send notifications regardless of the platform of the receiver. The keywords defined by the class can be sent using the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialization information and streaming context.
member.param: A containing information about the to be initialized.
A that indicates the source destination and context information of a serialized stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding
member.summary: This class represents the binding element of a Windows Notification tile, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh761491.aspx for details. This class is intended for use as part of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An initial set of for this tile.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An initial set of for this tile.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An initial set of for this tile.
An initial set of for this tile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Template
member.summary: One of the provided templates on which to base the tile. Typically, a developer should supply both a square and a wide format, each as a separate binding element. Valid entries are members of the tileTemplateType enumeration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Fallback
member.summary: A template to use if the primary template name is not recognized by the recipient, for use with Windows 8 compatibility. This value is the Windows 8 name of the value in the template attribute. New templates introduced after Windows 8 do not have a fallback.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Lang
member.summary: The target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as en-US or fr-FR. The locale specified here overrides any other specified locale, such as that in binding or visual. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.BaseUri
member.summary: A default base URI that is combined with relative URIs in image source attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Branding
member.summary: The form that the tile should use to display the app's brand.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Set to true to allow Windows to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language; for instance, a value of www.website.com/images/hello.png included in the notification becomes www.website.com/images/hello.png?ms-scale=100&ms-contrast=standard&ms-lang=en-us.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.ContentId
member.summary: Set to a sender-defined string that uniquely identifies the content of the notification. This prevents duplicates in the situation where a large tile template is displaying the last three wide tile notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Images
member.summary: Set of elements

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileBinding.Texts
member.summary: Set of elements

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage
member.summary: This class represents the image element of a Windows Notification tile, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh761491.aspx for details. This class is intended for use as part of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage.Id
member.summary: The image element in the tile template that this image is intended for. If a template has only one image, then this value is 1. The number of available image positions is based on the template definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage.Src
member.summary: The URI of the image source, one of these protocol handlers: http:// or https:// means a web-based image, ms-appx:/// means an image included in the app package, ms-appdata:///local/ means an image saved to local storage, and file:/// means a local image. (Supported only for desktop apps. This protocol cannot be used by Windows Store apps.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage.Alt
member.summary: A description of the image, for users of assistive technologies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileImage.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Set to true to allow Windows to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language; for instance, a value of www.website.com/images/hello.png included in the notification becomes www.website.com/images/hello.png?ms-scale=100&ms-contrast=standard&ms-lang=en-us.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText
member.summary: This class represents the text element of a Windows Notification tile, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh761491.aspx for details. This class is intended for use as part of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText.Id
member.summary: The text element in the tile template that this text is intended for. If a template has only one text element, then this value is 1. The number of available text positions is based on the template definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText.Lang
member.summary: The target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as en-US or fr-FR. The locale specified here overrides any other specified locale, such as that in binding or visual. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.TileText.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the tile element.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An initial set of bindings for this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.VisualTile.Version
member.summary: The version of the tile XML schema this particular payload was developed for. It can have two values, 1 or 2. Version 1 requires a valid payload under the Windows 8 schema. Version 2 recognizes the new large tile templates, the new Windows 8.1 template names for existing templates, and the fallback attribute of the binding element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.VisualTile.Lang
member.summary: The target locale of the XML payload, specified as a BCP-47 language tags such as en-US or fr-FR. The locale specified here overrides any other specified locale, such as that in binding or visual. If this value is a literal string, this attribute defaults to the user's UI language. If this value is a string reference, this attribute defaults to the locale chosen by Windows Runtime in resolving the string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.VisualTile.BaseUri
member.summary: A default base URI that is combined with relative URIs in image source attributes.

member.summary: The form that the tile should use to display the app's brand.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.VisualTile.AddImageQuery
member.summary: Set to true to allow Windows to append a query string to the image URI supplied in the tile notification. Use this attribute if your server hosts images and can handle query strings, either by retrieving an image variant based on the query strings or by ignoring the query string and returning the image as specified without the query string. This query string specifies scale, contrast setting, and language; for instance, a value of www.website.com/images/hello.png included in the notification becomes www.website.com/images/hello.png?ms-scale=100&ms-contrast=standard&ms-lang=en-us.

member.summary: Set to a sender-defined string that uniquely identifies the content of the notification. This prevents duplicates in the situation where a large tile template is displaying the last three wide tile notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Notifications.VisualTile.Bindings
member.summary: The specifies a tile templates. Every notification should include one binding element for each supported tile size.
